item.title: Loads of car bits which are sharp, 5th October
item.description:
So where the big fly tip is fridges and tvs , washing machines there is bits of car bumpers and wing and office chair also been dumped!! The woods is absolutely shocking . Not safe to walk children or animals as there is so much stuff in there. Something need to be put up to stop cars and trucks driving on there and dumping all this stuff.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wayside Grove, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 on public footpath between the, 5th October
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 on public footpath between the north end of Lairdale Estate and footpath streetlight column ID number 77 you have recently installed dual car charging points. At the back of footpath are two cabinets – one black (telecom) and green cabinet which I assume relates to car charges as new ie Lambeth property. Re move graffiti please. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview link – NB link does not show car charger and green cabinet as new: https://www.google.com/ maps/ @51.4468,-0.0996197,3a,15y,155.2h,85.75t/ data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sfAA1FwNrrgmxoUdGbS24kA!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D4.249914750803242%26panoid%3DfAA1FwNrrgmxoUdGbS24kA%26yaw%3D155.20065381598044!7i16384!8i8192?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkxNi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22-23, Burrow Walk, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Column No 21 Hayes Lane Beckenham, 5th October
item.description:
Column was involved in a car collision several weeks ago, it is only slightly leaning but has no lamp on top. Surely a lamp can be put on top temporarily until column is straightened or replaced as this is a dangerous corner and is very dark with no lamp on at night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Shortlands, London

item.title: Parking restriction boards still displayed, 5th October
item.description:

item.title: The zebra crossing near the junction of Swan Lane and High Road N20 gets flooded every time it rains, 5th October
item.description:
It’s difficult to cross the road after rain on the zebra crossing near the junction of Swan Lane and High Road N20 because although there’s a drain near there’s a small hump in the road preventing the water draining away so you have to get wet feet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Road, Whetstone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual overloading of bins and rubbish onto street, 5th October
item.description:
The block of flats at this address has for months overloaded their bins leaving rubbish on the floor. They also regularly leave unwanted items that should be taken to the tip on the street. It is unsafe and unhygienic for the children that regularly walk past this on the way to nursery. Please can this be resolved in the long term?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Talfourd Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large chunks of building falling down onto the pavement, 5th October
item.description:
Large chunks of brickwork of the building at 78 Wellington St, London SE18 6QF (what3words: ///maybe.oiled.winks) are falling down onto the pavement. It needs looking at urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant dumped household goods, 5th October
item.description:
Inbetween 41 &43 evelina rd I have reporter rubbish here 4 times in 3 weeks and dumped rubbish is still here Why? This is not private land but on council pavement Please clear or tell me why it’s not been cleared away please? Thank You

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelina Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
